title: Designing Mathematics Problem-Solving Strategies Using Cognitive Process Analysis Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts (functions, calculus, etc.) and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: A course for students aspiring to careers in medical/legal/technical fields to master efficient analysis and resolution of complex mathematical problems

learning_goals: Learners can explain strategies for systematically decomposing complex mathematical problems by applying cognitive load theory.
Learners can evaluate and improve their problem-solving processes using concept mapping, verbal reporting (think-aloud), and eye-tracking-based analysis techniques.
Learners can propose efficient designs for mathematical learning materials by applying the split-attention and redundancy principles.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
